text:
The election flying squad seized Rs.1.90 lakh from a businessman at Kakkanur near Bagalur on Monday morning.

The cash, reportedly unaccompanied by documents, was being carried by the businessman to his granite factory at Kandikuppam.

According to sources, the money purportedly for salary disbursement to the employees of the firm was seized since there were no supporting papers. With the model code of conduct in place, monitoring, especially at the border check-posts, has been beefed up.

Rs. 3.38 lakh stolen

from Tasmac outlet

In a midnight robbery, a Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation (Tasmac) outlet here in the town limits was broken into and cash totalling Rs. 3.38 lakh was stolen in the small hours of Monday.

The cash collected over three days from March 4 to 6 was left in the cash box on Sunday night, before the outlet near Subedarmedu was shut for the night. In the wee hours of Monday, a guard of a nearby eatery had noticed the TASMAC outlet’s front door wide open, raising suspicion of a robbery.

The guard had informed the eatery owner, who in turn alerted the TASMAC manager and salesman. Following the alert, police were informed. Police have registered a case.
title: Cash seized
